item.title: Splitting up large geoTIFF orthomosaics
item.description: Doodler can work with really large images, but it is usually best to keep your images < 10,000 pixels in any dimension, because then the program will do CRF inference on the whole image at once rather than in chunks. This usually results in better image segmentations that are more consistent with your doodles.

item.title: merge a 3-band and 1-band image
item.description: Doodler can use 1, 3, and 4-band input imagery. If the imagery is 3-band, it is assumed to be RGB and is, by default, augmented with 3 additional derivative bands.

item.title: no spaces in filenames!
item.description: Spaces in image file names are problematic for the program because it uses filename string subsections to match images to outputs. White space is the escape character for most programming languages.
